securityFindings.evidence: Critical headers missing: CSP, Server: Heroku

solution.solution: Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) and remove the Server header to prevent information leakage and mitigate potential attacks.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Implement a Content Security Policy (CSP) header to restrict the sources from which the browser is permitted to load resources.
Step 2: Remove or mask the Server header to prevent revealing the server software version.
Step 3: Test the application after implementing the changes to verify that the CSP is correctly configured and the Server header is no longer exposed.

resource_links.title: OWASP Content Security Policy Cheat Sheet
Understanding and Implementing Content Security Policy
Content Security Policy (CSP) Explained by Google

waf_rules:
SecRule RESPONSE_STATUS "^[45]" "id:1001,phase:3,t:none,log,deny,msg:'Missing Security Header',chain"
SecRule RESPONSE_HEADERS:Content-Security-Policy "!@rx .+"
solution.notes: Properly configuring CSP requires careful planning and testing to avoid breaking legitimate functionality.

securityFindings.evidence: Critical headers missing: CSP, Server: Heroku

solution.solution: Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) and hide server information to mitigate potential information disclosure and cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Implement CSP by configuring the web server to send the Content-Security-Policy header.
Step 2: Remove or mask the 'Server' header to prevent information leakage about the server technology being used.
Step 3: Test the implemented CSP and verify that the 'Server' header is no longer revealing sensitive information.

resource_links.title: Content Security Policy (CSP)
A Guide to Content Security Policy
Content Security Policy (CSP) - Computerphile

solution.notes: Implementing a robust CSP is crucial for preventing XSS attacks. Carefully consider the allowed sources for scripts, styles, and other resources.

securityFindings.evidence: Critical headers missing: CSP, Server: Heroku

solution.solution: Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) and hide server information to mitigate potential information disclosure and cross-site scripting risks.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Configure your web server (e.g., Nginx, Apache) or application framework (e.g., Node.js with Helmet) to send appropriate HTTP response headers.
Step 2: Implement a Content Security Policy (CSP) that restricts the sources from which the browser is permitted to load resources.
Step 3: Remove or mask the Server header to prevent information disclosure about the server software in use.
Step 4: Test the configuration in a staging environment before deploying to production to ensure that it does not break existing functionality.
Step 5: Monitor the CSP reports in the browser's console or through a dedicated reporting tool to identify and address any violations.

resource_links.title: OWASP Content Security Policy Cheat Sheet
Hiding Server Information for Security
Content Security Policy Tutorial

solution.notes: Ensure CSP policies are carefully tested to avoid unintended blocking of legitimate resources.

securityFindings.evidence: Critical headers missing: CSP, Server: Heroku

solution.solution: Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) and remove or mask the 'Server' header to enhance security.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Configure CSP to restrict allowed sources for various content types (scripts, styles, images, etc.).
Step 2: Remove or mask the 'Server' header in your server configuration to prevent information leakage about your server software.
Step 3: Test the implemented CSP directives and header modifications to ensure they do not break site functionality.

solution.notes: Carefully evaluate CSP directives to avoid blocking legitimate resources. Monitor for CSP violations in your browser console and adjust accordingly.

waf_rules: SecRule RESPONSE_HEADERS:Server "Heroku" "id:1234,phase:4,t:lowercase,deny,msg:'Server header is leaking information'"
solution.notes: Carefully define CSP directives to avoid blocking legitimate resources. Consider using a report-uri directive for monitoring policy violations.

solution.solution: Implement proper input validation and sanitization, and utilize parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Implement strict input validation to filter special characters like quotes and semicolons in the 'to' parameter.
Step 2: Migrate to using parameterized queries or prepared statements in the backend database interactions to prevent SQL injection.
Step 3: Regularly scan and test the application for SQL injection vulnerabilities using automated tools and manual penetration testing.

resource_links.title: OWASP SQL Injection Prevention Cheat Sheet
Preventing SQL Injection in Node.js Applications
SQL Injection Explained

solution.notes: Ensure database user has least privilege access.

solution.solution: Implement proper header configurations to prevent sensitive information leakage and enable security features.
remediation_steps: Step 1: Configure the web server (e.g., Nginx, Apache) to suppress the 'Server' header or set it to a non-revealing value.
Step 2: Implement security-related headers like 'X-Frame-Options', 'X-Content-Type-Options', and 'Content-Security-Policy' to mitigate various attacks.
Step 3: Regularly review and update header configurations to align with current security best practices and address emerging threats.

resource_links.title: OWASP Secure Headers Project
A Complete Guide to HTTP Security Headers
HTTP Security Headers - Computerphile

solution.notes: Hiding the 'Server' header and implementing security headers enhance the application's security posture by reducing information leakage and mitigating common attacks.
